title: Jennifer Lopez's Versace Catwalk Moment Sparks Surge In Green Dress Searches
text:
From ELLE

Jennifer Lopez broke the internet last week, as she donned her iconic Versace dress once more for the brand's catwalk show at Milan Fashion Week.

The original look was searched for so much that Google Images was specifically created to answer their most popular search query yet, “Jennifer Lopez’s green dress”. Now almost two decades later, the new version of the iconic dress has gone viral yet again.





Like to Know It reported a 1,200 per cent increase in searches for green dresses, following Lopez’s appearance on the catwalk. Last week at Milan Fashion Week, J Lo closed the runway at Versace's spring/summer 2020 show - wearing a replica of her iconic Grammys dress from 2000.

Photo credit: Scott Gries - Getty Images More

Photo credit: Jacopo Raule - Getty Images More

The original 19-year-old dress featured sheer long-sleeves and a floating skirt, whereas the 2019 update showcased a leotard style still in the same iconic palm print. The pop star then later changed into a mini-dress version, along with matching boots, for the show after-party.

Photo credit: Arnold Jerocki - Getty Images More

The show ended with both Lopez and Donatella Versace walking side by side down the runway.

You Might Also Like
description: The singer closed Versace's show wearing the famed gown during Milan Fashion Week
